curam.util.persistence.helper

Class State<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.persistence.helper.State<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of the value used to signify the state of the state machine.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CodetableState

    public abstract class State<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates the processing associated with state transitions for a state machine.
    See Also:
    TransactionHelper

      • State

                V state,
                boolean modifyAllowed,

        Protected constructor for use by anonymous classes.
        Parameters:
        states - map to which to add this new state
        state - the value held to signify that the state machine is in this state
        modifyAllowed - whether "CRUD" modifications are permitted when the state machine is in this state
        removeAllowed - whether physical database removal is permitted when state machine is in this state

      • onEnter

        protected void onEnter()
        Notifies the implementation that the state machine is entering (i.e. transitioning to) this state. By default does nothing. Implementations may override to supply custom validation logic (or other processing) for entering this state.

      • onLeave

        protected void onLeave()
        Notifies the implementation that the state machine is leaving (i.e. transitioning from) this state. By default does nothing. Implementations may override to supply custom validation logic (or other processing) for leaving this state.

      • onUnsupportedTransitionFrom

        protected abstract void onUnsupportedTransitionFrom(State<V> oldState)
        Identifies that an unsupported transition has been attempted. Implementations must override this method to supply their own custom processing or validation error message. Note that the processing is from the point-of-view of the state being transitioned to - typically, the name of the state being transitioned to bears a resemblance to the user action being performed, e.g. a state of "closed" is typically transitioned to under an action named "close()".
        Parameters:
        oldState - The state being transitioned from.

      • transitionTo

        public void transitionTo(State<V> newState)
        Transitions from this state to the new state specified. Performs the following:
        • notifies the implementation of this state that the state machine is leaving this state;
        • validations that the particular transition between the old and new states is known to have been specified as a permitted transition;
        • notifies the transition implementation that the state machine is undergoing this known transition; and
        • notifies the implementation of the new state that the state machine is entering the new state.
        These multiple steps effectively allow implementations to normalize logic (e.g. validations) to specify common logic in a single appropriate location:
        • processing which applies when transitioning from this state to any other should be placed in State.onLeave();
        • processing which applies when transitioning to the new state from any other should be placed in State.onEnter() (on the new state); and
        • processing which applies solely to this transition should be placed on Transition.onTransition().
        Parameters:
        newState - the state being transitioned to from this state.
